intro: Polyechma abyssinicum, commonly known as the Abyssinian polyechma, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, thriving in temperate climates. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in umbels, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
